title: Design of a Blended Learning-Based Language Creative Problem Solving (CPS) Course: Integration of Text Analysis, Writing, and Diverse Expression

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental problem-solving abilities, digital device utilization skills, basic grammar comprehension and text interpretation capabilities, and foundational vocabulary expansion skills.
context.additional_context: A course focusing on cultivating real-world problem-solving abilities (resolving communication barriers, text restructuring, context-based expression optimization) through CPS training integrated with language subjects (reading, writing, speaking, listening). Learners analyze texts across genres (expository, argumentative, creative) to acquire creative problem-solving strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically address language-related problems (analyzing complex text structures, diagnosing vocabulary usage errors) from discovery to acceptance planning using the CPS 6-stage model

Learners can apply creative thinking skills (idea generation, diversifying expressions, metaphor creation) in a blended learning environment combining digital tools (pads/tablets) and paper-based activities (writing notebooks, vocabulary maps, concept mapping)

Learners can enhance critical thinking skills (text critique, alternative expression exploration, context-based restructuring) through iterative solution refinement incorporating peer feedback (evaluating grammatical accuracy, logical coherence, lexical appropriateness)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
